input:
######################## number of models
# Number of models for which details are described in this input file 24
######################## particles
1000
######################## dt
# Internal timestep for solver. # Make this small for a stiff model. 0.0001
######################## User-supplied data
# times: For ABC SMC, times must be a whitespace delimited list # In simulation mode these are the timepoints for which the simulations will be output 10.0 70.0 80.0 100.0 110.0
# Numbers of parameters defined in models below 4
# Single or subset of parameters to be considered for calculation of mututal inforamtion: param1 param2
######################## Models
model1 Exp_1.xml Exp_1.cu
# type: the method used to simulate your model. ODE, SDE or Gillespie. ODE
# Fitting information. If fit is ALL, all species in the model are fitted to the data in the order they are listed in the model. # Otherwise, give a whitespace delimited list of fitting instrictions the same length as the dimensions of your data. # Use speciesN to denote the Nth species in your model. Simple arithmetic operations can be performed on the species from your model. # For example, to fit the sum of the first two species in your model to your first variable, write fit: species1+species2 species1-species10
# Priors on initial conditions, compartments and parameters: # one of # constant, value # normal, mean, variance # uniform, lower, upper # lognormal, mean, variance
constant 0.0 constant 1.0 constant 0.0 constant 0.0 constant 0.0 constant 0.0
constant 1
constant 1 0 uniform 1 10 normal 10 1000 lognormal 10 2000
model2 Exp_2.xml Exp_2.cu
# type: the method used to simulate your model. ODE, SDE or Gillespie. ODE
# Fitting information. Simple arithmetic operations can be performed on the species from your model. # For example, to fit the sum of the first two species in your model to your first variable, write fit: species1+species2 species1-species10
# Priors on initial conditions, compartments and parameters: # one of # constant, value # normal, mean, variance # uniform, lower, upper # lognormal, mean, variance
constant 0.0 constant 1.0 constant 0.0 constant 0.0 constant 0.0 constant 0.0
constant 1
constant 1 0 uniform 1 10 normal 10 1000 lognormal 10 2000
